greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Symmetric square array, read by antidiagonals, where the inverse binomial transform of row n equals: [C(n,0)*1, C(n,1)*2,..., C(n,k)*A051163(k), ..., C(n,n)*A051163(n)] and where A051162 equals the antidiagonal sums.
comment: Antidiagonal sums form A051163. Main diagonal is A100937. Different from A086620.
formula: T(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..n} C(k, j)*C(n, j)*A051162(j), with T(0, 0) = 1 and where Sum_{i=0..n} T(n-i, i) = A051162(n).
example: The inverse binomial transform of the rows form the respective rows of the triangle B:
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 23 2004
